dialogue.htmlContent:
[pc.Stepping] out of the room, you and Ghost follow Hammer as he unlocks a door on your right and leads you into another corridor. A second door is unlocked, and then the three of you are standing outside in a narrow alley behind the Enforcer station.

[hammer.speech(It's quicker to get to the hideout this way,)] Hammer states as he removes a padlock from a barbed-wire gate at the end of the alley. Locking it behind you, he adds, [hammer.speech(We won't be seen by as many of the gang's lookouts by going this way as well.)]

Although the alleyways which you subsequently find yourself travelling through appear to be deserted at first glance, you soon spot a couple of shady-looking figures keeping watch from the shadows. Holding Hammer's hand and leaning into him to make it appear as though the two of them are a couple, Ghost lets out a surprisingly youthful giggle and teases her partner, [ghost.speech(Looking forward to having some fun tonight?)]

Hammer pulls his cap down further over his eyes and lets out a deep grunt. The lookouts seem to have been fooled by the show Ghost has put on, for the three of you arrive at the Enforcer's hideout without causing any alarm to be raised.

Their hideout takes the form of a derelict building, and the Enforcers have led you to a rotten, graffiti-covered door situated to its rear. Following the two of them inside, you see that the staircase has collapsed and several large holes have been smashed in the walls. Revealing why this building was chosen as their hideout, Ghost states, [ghost.speech(The gang's HQ is across the street from this building. We've been observing them from here for a few weeks now; take a look through that hole over there. Oh, and stay away from the windows.)]

Peeking through the hole which Ghost has pointed out, you find yourself looking out onto an unusually wide alleyway. Directly opposite from where you're positioned, you can quite clearly see the entire frontage of an old, abandoned bakery. A couple of tall, muscular figures are lighting up a couple of cigarettes outside the entrance. At first you assume that they're horse-boys, but as the orange glow from their lighter catches in their red and orange eyes, you realise that they're half-horse, half-demon nightmares. As they talk, one of them pumps his hips and makes some kind of joke, to which the other laughs and gives his companion a high-five. With their cigarettes still lit, they open the bakery's front door and disappear into the building.

Hammer nods as you report what you've just seen, before saying, [hammer.speech(It's too early for Angelixx to show up yet; she usually doesn't make an appearance until around midnight. Those nightmares always arrive an hour or two before she does, though, so perhaps she'll be early tonight. We'd better get geared up right away.)]

Pulling up a couple of loose floorboards in one corner of the room, Hammer lifts out a couple of large, black duffel bags. He and Ghost then quickly strip out of their civilian clothing, before pulling Enforcer gear out of the bags and putting it on.

[ghost.speech(I'd rather be wearing trainers than these,)] Ghost complains as she pulls on a pair of sturdy-looking boots. As she does up the laces, she adds, [ghost.speech(They make my heels ache and it's hard for me to move silently in them...)]

[hammer.speech(I don't recall you complaining about them when they saved your feet from those caltrops a couple of months back,)] Hammer grunts as he pulls on a heavy plate carrier and sets about doing up the straps.

A couple of minutes later and the two Enforcers are fully kitted out in military-style gear. Ghost's setup look to be a little lighter than Hammer's, but they're both wearing boots, trousers, battle belts, and plate carriers. Fixing a dagger to one side of her belt, Ghost attaches a holster to the other, before sliding an old, worn-looking revolver into it. Hammer's choice of weaponry is a little less subtle, as he lifts a huge, 4-gauge shotgun from out of the space beneath the floorboards.

[hammer.speech(Now we wait for the succubus to show up,)] Hammer states, before sitting on an upturned metal bucket and saying to you, [hammer.speech(Got any questions while we wait?)]

Looking at the shotgun that Hammer has leant up against the wall beside him, you ask him if that's his normal choice of weapon.

[hammer.speech(Only on ops like this, where we can't risk being recognised,)] Hammer replies, [hammer.speech(This thing's a bit of relic; they were phased out of Enforcer service in the late eighties. They fire tear gas grenades, which are good enough, but the modern pepper grenade launcher is far more effective. See this marking on the side?)]

You take a closer look at the side of the shotgun as Hammer holds it towards you. The Enforcer's five-pointed star symbol has been scratched out, and beside it a striking arrow within a circle has been carved into the metal.

[hammer.speech(That's one of the symbols the HLF used,)] the wolf-boy reveals, [hammer.speech(The 'Human Liberation Front' got their hands on a lot of Enforcer gear back in the Fifth Human Rebellion. This one was used against us until the owner's jaw felt my fist. It went 'missing' from the evidence room many years ago, so it can't be traced back to us.)]

[ghost.speech(I prefer a more subtle approach,)] Ghost says as she unsheathes her dagger and shows off its wicked, poison-enchanted ethereal blade. Patting the revolver at her hip, she adds, [ghost.speech(When I can't get up close and personal, this does the trick. Like Hammer's shotgun, this was in the hands of the HLF; I picked it up off a particularly stubborn human on Green Grass Hill...)]

[hammer.speech(We never recovered even half of the weapons that the HLF had,)] Hammer says, [hammer.speech(Thousands are thought to be in the hands of gangs all across the realm, so us using them tonight won't identify us as Enforcers.)]

You point out that their weapons might not, but they're wearing what's clearly Enforcer gear. Surely that'll be enough to identify them to the gang members.

[ghost.speech(All the serious gangs are wearing SWORD gear,)] Ghost replies with a weary smirk on her face. [ghost.speech(Too many Enforcer quartermasters over the years have become very wealthy while marking down an abnormally high amount of equipment as being 'destroyed in the line of duty'. The gang we're going to be dealing with tonight will think that we're a serious rival operation from Dominion.)]

#IF(pc.hasQuestInLine(QUEST_LINE_SIDE_WES, QUEST_WES_3_WES)) [hammer.speech(I heard some fox in 1st Battalion put a stop to that in Dominion. Was a local boy from around here too. Good on him,)] Hammer says. Recognising the fact that he's talking about Wes, you tell the Enforcers that you helped the fox-boy he's talking about. Hammer gives an approving nod in response, before grunting, [hammer.seepch(Good to hear that there's still at least one guy who's doing something about the corruption in Dominion.)] #ENDIF

Thinking that it must be challenging to come up against gangs who have the same kit as them, you ask the Enforcers if the proliferation of SWORD equipment to gangs makes their job a lot harder.

[hammer.speech(Hardware is one thing, training and experience are another,)] Hammer replies, [hammer.speech(Besides, the vast majority of gangs are motivated by money, which doesn't make them fight as hard as you might think.)]

Thinking that it would be best to know what you're likely to come up against once inside, you ask the Enforcers what to expect from the gang in terms of combat capabilities.

[ghost.speech(They're just a bunch of amateurs,)] Ghost dismissively states, [ghost.speech(The only ones who might be more than that are those two nightmare you saw earlier, as well as Angelixx herself.)]

[hammer.speech(The succubus is meant to be a coward, though,)] Hammer says, [hammer.speech(and those two bodyguards of hers aren't anything to be concerned about.)]

[ghost.speech(True, there shouldn't be any difficulty,)] Ghost says, before turning to smile at you and say, [ghost.speech(Remember, you're not here to fight, you're here to get Lovienne off our backs if we're recognised. Leave the violence to us.)]

Wanting to know how they plan on dealing with Angelixx, you ask the two Enforcers what their plan is for when you encounter the succubus.

[hammer.speech(I'll shoot her,)] Hammer grunts, giving his mean-looking shotgun a pat as he does so. [hammer.speech(If that isn't enough, then I'll show her some SWORD close combat techniques.)]

[ghost.speech(Leave the close combat to me,)] Ghost says with a sly smile on her face, before replying to your initial question, [ghost.speech(Angelixx won't be an issue; even if she turns out to not be a complete coward, we've taken down hundreds of demons before. She won't be an issue.)]

[hammer.speech(Just don't let her talk too much,)] Hammer grunts, [hammer.speech(If she can't fight, she's bound to have some tricks up her sleeve. I'd wager that she's using telepathy or some other kind of arcane spell to control her gang. Don't let her get into your head.)]

Wondering if the three of you are going to be enough to handle an entire gang, you ask Hammer and Ghost if they're going to call for the other SWORD Enforcers as soon as they start the operation.

[hammer.speech(I'll call for them if they're needed, not before,)] Hammer replies, [hammer.speech(The two of us will be more than enough to deal with a bunch of amateurs.)]

[ghost.speech(It's probably for the best that the gang's increased vigilance forced us into leaving most of the squad behind,)] Ghost adds, [ghost.speech(If we were to start the op with everyone present then Angelixx might get spooked and teleport away before we get a chance to deal with her.)]

[hammer.speech(Good point,)] Hammer grunts, before holding up a small, dark-purple orb for you to see and explaining, [hammer.speech(If the gang turns out to be more competent than we're expecting then I'll activate this resonance stone. Its counterpart is back at the Enforcer station, and if it's activated then the rest of the squad will be here within a couple of minutes.)]

Curious to find out what it's like to be a member of SWORD, you ask Hammer and Ghost what sort of duties they're expected to perform.

[hammer.speech(The small-time criminals are for the Patrol officers, which leaves all the big boys and girls for us in SWORD to deal with,)] Hammer says, [hammer.speech(We go after organised crime, serious gangs, and criminals who are simply too dangerous or strong for the Patrol guys and gals to deal with.)]

[ghost.speech(We're not just the muscle; we do a lot of the investigative work as well,)] Ghost adds, [ghost.speech(Of course, ORICL often has targets which we need to deal with, but most of the time we're gathering our own intelligence to act upon.)]

Wondering how often they go out on missions like this one, you ask the two Enforcers if they're behind a desk more often than not.

[ghost.speech(Well, we do carry out a lot of ops, but most of our time is in the office or out on the streets gathering intel or pursuing different leads,)] Ghost replies, [ghost.speech(Our unit leans more into carrying out ops like this one, although I guess tonight's a special one; we normally number at least eight and use modern SWORD gear. Other units are more focused on solving serious crime, and others are bit too close to ORICL for comfort...)]

[hammer.speech(Snatching people off the streets for saying something bad about Lilith isn't what I signed up for,)] Hammer grunts, [hammer.speech(ORICL should do their own dirty work...)]

[ghost.speech(Our unit's all on the same page on that one,)] Ghost says, before taking another look through the hole in the wall and sighing, [hammer.speech(No sign of Angelixx yet...)]

You get as comfortable as the derelict building will allow and wait for the operation to start. Hammer and Ghost take turns at the hole in the wall, keeping watch for any sign of the succubus, Angelixx. Although the three of you make some occassional small talk, nothing much is said for the rest of the evening.

[hammer.speech(It's almost midnight,)] Hammer eventually grunts after taking a look at his watch. Tutting to himself, he grumbles, [hammer.speech(Angelixx is normally here by now... Maybe she called off the meeting tonight?)]

[ghost.speech(No, the usual number of gang members have shown up,)] Ghost says from her position at the hole in the wall, before suddenly hissing, [ghost.speech(Shit! She's already inside! I just saw her through the bedroom window!)]

[hammer.speech(Fuck, she must have gone in through the back,)] Hammer grunts as he leaps to his feet, [hammer.speech(Every other time she's used the front door. Of course she'd choose this night to change her habits...)]

Pulling on their balaclavas and strapping their ballistic helmets into place, Ghost and Hammer quickly check their weapons and turn to face you.

[hammer.speech(I'm going in through the front, Ghost'll take the back. Which one of us do you want to stick with?)] Hammer asks as he picks up a sledgehammer which had been resting against the wall.

Thinking that it would be safer to be with the large wolf-boy and his fearsome-looking shotgun, you tell Hammer that you'll go with him. Giving you a brief nod, he opens the door and rushes across the street, while Ghost slips off down an alleyway to the side of the bakery.

[hammer.speech(Stand back,)] the wolf-boy grunts as the two of you come to a halt beside the bakery's front door. Giving the wolf-boy some space, you watch as he lifts his sledgehammer and swings it at a point just beside the door's handle. The heavy mass of metal turns a huge chunk of weathered wood into a shower of splinters. The force of the blow completely shatters the lock and slams the door wide open in the process.

Having served its purpose, the wolf-boy tosses his sledgehammer aside and lifts up his shotgun. Giving you the briefest of nods, he rushes into the building...

Thinking that it would be better to rely on Ghost and her combination of wicked-looking dagger and revolver, you tell the otter-girl that you'll go with her. Giving you a brief nod, Hammer opens the door and rushes across the street to the bakery's front door, while Ghost motions for you to follow her and slips off down an alleyway to one side of the building.

[hammer.speech(Stay quiet,)] the otter-girl whispers as you catch up with her. Doing your best to move stealthily, you follow Ghost as she sneaks through the shadows and around the corner to the rear of the bakery. Just as with the front of the building, the gang has neglected to post a sentry, and so Ghost is able to get to the back door without issue. Producing a lockpick, she has the door open in seconds, and uses a hand signal to gesture for you to follow her inside.

Sliding her dagger out of its sheath, the otter-girl silently slips into the shadowy interior...

The gang members collapse to the floor, utterly defeated. #IF(flags.hasFlag(FLAG_innoxia_hammer_following)) Quickly stepping forwards, Hammer kicks their weapons away, and with another couple of kicks he makes sure that they're not getting up any time soon. Turning to look at you, he grunts, [hammer.speech(They'd do the same to us. Come on, we need to keep moving.)] #ELSE Quickly darting forwards, Ghost kicks their weapons away, and with a couple of swift stabs with her arcane dagger she makes sure that they're well and truly drained of energy. Turning to look at you, she smirks and says, [ghost.speech(It's better than they deserve. Come on, we need to keep moving.)] #ENDIF

Knowing that you need to find and beat Angelixx as quickly as possible, you do as #IF(flags.hasFlag(FLAG_innoxia_hammer_following)) Hammer says and follow him #IF(flags.hasFlag(FLAG_innoxia_ghost_following)) and Ghost #ENDIF further into the building... #ELSE Ghost says and follow her further into the building... #ENDIF

You can't bring yourself to fight any more and back away from the conflict. #IF(flags.hasFlag(FLAG_innoxia_hammer_following)) Thankfully, Hammer is more than enough to defeat the gang members, and after a couple of rounds from his shotgun his opponents have collapsed to the floor. #ELSE Thankfully, Ghost is more than enough to defeat the gang members, and after a couple of rounds from her revolver her opponents have collapsed to the floor. #ENDIF #IF(flags.hasFlag(FLAG_innoxia_hammer_following)) Quickly stepping forwards, the wolf-boy kicks their weapons away, and with another couple of kicks he makes sure that they're not getting up any time soon. Turning to look at you, he grunts, [hammer.speech(They'd do the same to us. Come on, we need to keep moving.)] #ELSE Quickly darting forwards, the otter-girl kicks their weapons away, and with a couple of swift stabs with her arcane dagger she makes sure that they're well and truly drained of energy. Turning to look at you, she smirks and says, [ghost.speech(It's better than they deserve. Come on, we need to keep moving.)] #ENDIF

Knowing that you need to find and beat Angelixx as quickly as possible, you do as #IF(flags.hasFlag(FLAG_innoxia_hammer_following)) Hammer says and follow him #IF(flags.hasFlag(FLAG_innoxia_ghost_following)) and Ghost #ENDIF further into the building... #ELSE Ghost says and follow her further into the building... #ENDIF

Turning a corner in the alleyways, you find yourself standing before the abandoned bakery which served as the headquarters for Angelixx's gang. The front door, having been destroyed by Hammer at the start of their raid, has been replaced by several sheets of plywood held together by rusty nails and old planks of wood. Although someone has taken the trouble to put up this makeshift barrier, the building looks to be completely deserted.

Knowing that it would be far more trouble than it's worth to try and gain entry to the abandoned bakery, you [pc.walk] past the building and continue on your way through the alleyways of Elis...

#IF(!flags.hasFlag(FLAG_innoxia_sword_mission_back_door) && !flags.hasFlag(FLAG_innoxia_hammer_following))

Following Ghost into the building, you find yourself entering a small, dimly-lit pantry. The food and drink which were once stored in here are long gone, and in their place old, empty cans and ruined bags of flour are strewn across the shelves. What grabs your attention the most, however, is a massive, hulking alligator-boy. Thankfully his back is towards you, and so he hasn't seen you or Ghost.

[ghost.speech(Stay here,)] the small otter-girl whispers in your ear. Deciding to do as she says, you remain stationary and watch as the comparatively tiny Enforcer sneaks up on the gang member. With a nimble leap that you didn't think possible for a woman of her age, Ghost jumps up onto the guard's back, hooking her left arm around his neck and slamming his lower jaw upwards so as to prevent him from crying out. With the poison-bladed dagger in her right paw, she repeatedly drives it deep into her target, first into his throat, and then into his chest. The sudden, overwhelming violence of Ghost's attack completely overwhelms the massive alligator-boy, and he crumples to the ground with a heavy thud. Luckily for him, Ghost's blade is arcane in nature, and so you see that he's still breathing, although imagine that he isn't likely to regain consciousness any time soon after being struck so many times.

Nimbly jumping off the gang member's back as he falls to the floor, Ghost motions for you to catch up as she slips into the kitchen...

#ELSE

You find yourself standing in the small, dimly-lit pantry that's situated behind the bakery's kitchen. The food and drink which were once stored in here are long gone, and in their place old, empty cans and ruined bags of flour are strewn across the shelves. The back door which #IF(flags.hasFlag(FLAG_innoxia_sword_mission_chose_hammer)) Ghost #ELSE you and Ghost #ENDIF used to enter the bakery is found here.

Slumped down on the floor on one side of the room is a huge, muscular alligator-boy. Having been on the receiving end of Ghost's dagger, he;'s not likely to be getting up any time soon.

[ghost.speech(Come on, we need to go the other way,)] Ghost hisses, before turning to return to the kitchen...

#ENDIF

#IF(!flags.hasFlag(FLAG_innoxia_sword_mission_kitchen) && !flags.hasFlag(FLAG_innoxia_hammer_following))

Following Ghost into the kitchen, you see more signs that this bakery has been out of commission for some time. The large ovens which must have once baked hundreds of loaves of bread a day are covered with cobwebs and a thick layer of dust. All of the metal bread racks and other pieces of kitchen furniture have been piled up in the middle of the long room, effectively creating an impassable barrier that splits the area in two.

What draws your attention the most, however, is the pair of gang members who are standing a short way in front of you. This encounter isn't going to be as straightforward as the last one, for both of them have seen you and Ghost enter the kitchen.

[gangMember1.speech(Where did you come from?!)] the [gangMember1.raceFull(true)] demands.

[gangMember2.speech(What did you do to Jaws? You're going to fucking pay!)] the [gangMember2.raceFull(true)] standing next to [gangMember1.herHim] shouts.

[ghost.speech(Leave this to me,)] Ghost says to you, [ghost.speech(they won't take me long...)]

#ELSEIF(flags.hasFlag(FLAG_innoxia_hammer_following) && !flags.hasFlag(FLAG_innoxia_ghost_following))

Following Hammer through the door, you find yourself entering the bakery's kitchen, where you see more signs that this business has been out of commission for some time. The large ovens which must have once baked hundreds of loaves of bread a day are covered with cobwebs and a thick layer of dust. All of the metal bread racks and other pieces of kitchen furniture have been removed, leaving this area looking very empty.

As you look around the room, you see the familiar figure of Ghost standing beside one of the ovens. A couple of gang members are collapsed down, unconscious, at her feet, and as she turns to face you she reveals, [ghost.speech(I didn't expect you here yet. I've only just finished with these two.)]

[hammer.speech(You used to be a lot quicker,)] Hammer grunts as he quickly steps over to his partner.

[ghost.speech(Being quick isn't always a good thing,)] Ghost replies, and you can tell that she's smirking beneath her balaclava. She lowers her voice as Hammer approaches her, but not enough to prevent you from overhearing her tease, [ghost.speech(My place later, just like old times.)]

Letting out a deep, rumbling growl, Hammer motions for you to follow as he moves in front of Ghost to take the lead...

#ELSE

You find yourself moving through the bakery's kitchen, where you see more signs that this business has been out of commission for some time. The large ovens which must have once baked hundreds of loaves of bread a day are covered with cobwebs and a thick layer of dust. #IF(flags.hasFlag(FLAG_innoxia_sword_mission_chose_hammer)) All of the metal bread racks and other pieces of kitchen furniture have been removed, leaving this area looking very empty. #ELSE All of the metal bread racks and other pieces of kitchen furniture have been piled up in the middle of the long room, effectively creating an impassable barrier that splits the area in two. #ENDIF

[ghost.speech(Come on, let's keep moving,)] Ghost hisses to you while nimbly moving forwards...

#ENDIF

Deciding to do as Ghost says, you move back to give her some space as she prepares to fight the two gang members.

[gangMember1.speech(Hah! You think you can beat us alone? You're so small an imp coul-)] the [gangMember1.name] starts to taunt, but [gangMember1.sheIs] silenced by three shots fired in quick succession from Ghost's revolver. The gelatin capsules burst in contact with [gangMember1.her] aura, splattering [gangMember1.herHim] with burning, stinging oil.

The [gangMember2.name] manages to leap to one side and narrowly dodge two of the next three shots which Ghost fires at [gangMember2.herHim]. Although the single shot which connects with [gangMember2.her] aura isn't enough to down [gangMember2.herHim], Ghost rushes forwards with unexpected speed and plunges her dagger into [gangMember2.her] side. Nimbly darting between the two gang members, the small otter-girl stabs each of them dozens of times, before rolling to one side and raising her revolver to shoot them again.

No more shots ring out, however, as Ghost's two opponents collapse to the ground and lose consciousness. After checking her firearm and dagger to make sure that they've suffered no damage during the fight, the otter-girl smiles at you and, careful to avoid using Hammer's name, says, [ghost.speech(Let's get moving; we'll link up with our partner and finish clearing this level.)]

Dozens of bread racks and other pieces of kitchen furniture have been wheeled to this location and jammed on top of one another to create an impassable barricade.

#IF(flags.hasFlag(FLAG_innoxia_hammer_following)) [hammer.speech(I could tear this down, but it would take too much time,)] Hammer growls, [hammer.speech(Let's find another way around.)] #ELSE [ghost.speech(We could tear this down, but it would take too much time,)] Ghost muses out loud, before turning to face you and saying, [ghost.speech(Let's find another way around.)] #ENDIF

The wide, double-hinged door before you separates the bakery's kitchens and its shop floor. #IF(flags.hasFlag(FLAG_innoxia_hammer_following)) #IF(flags.hasFlag(FLAG_innoxia_ghost_following)) Hammer and Ghost quickly stack up next to this door without saying a word, before preparing to push it open and clear whatever might be waiting on the other side... #ELSE Hammer quickly moves up next to this door without saying a word, before preparing to push it open and clear whatever might be waiting on the other side... #ENDIF #ELSE Ghost quickly moves up next to this door without saying a word, before preparing to push it open and clear whatever might be waiting on the other side... #ENDIF

#IF(!flags.hasFlag(FLAG_innoxia_sword_mission_shop_floor) && !flags.hasFlag(FLAG_innoxia_ghost_following))

Following Hammer into the building, you find yourself [pc.stepping] into the area which once served as the bakery's shop floor. The shelving units, tables, and chairs which were left here when the bakery was abandoned have either been pushed up against the far wall or used to smash the glass counter to pieces, leaving all of the floor area in this room clear of furniture.

Four startled-looking gang members are standing a short distance away, and upon catching sight of you and Hammer, they pull out their weapons and get ready for a fight. The nearest one, a rough-looking cat-boy, spits on the floor and confidently strides towards you, growling as he does so, [style.speechMasculine(You don't know who you're fucking with. You're gonna pay for thi-)]

His speech is quickly and brutally interrupted as Hammer darts forwards with surprising speed and uses the butt of his shotgun to deliver a crushing blow to the side of the cat-boy's head. The gang member instantly crumples to the floor in an unconscious daze. Upon seeing his comrade being dealt with in such a swift and violent manner, one of the remaining three gang members turns and runs away.

The other two, [gangMember1.a_raceFull(true)] and [gangMember2.a_raceFull(true)] stand their ground, with the first one shouting in anger, [gangMember1.speech(You'll fucking pay for that!)]

A fight seems inevitable, and so you need to decide whether to assist Hammer or stand back and watch...

#ELSEIF(!flags.hasFlag(FLAG_innoxia_hammer_following)) #IF(game.getCharactersPresent().contains(hammer))

Moving quickly forwards, you and Ghost approach the one-eyed wolf-boy. Stepping over the two bodies at his feet, he grunts, [hammer.speech(Took your time. You used to be quicker.)]

[ghost.speech(Being quick isn't always a good thing,)] Ghost replies, and you can tell that she's smirking beneath her balaclava. She lowers her voice as she steps past Hammer, but not enough to prevent you from overhearing her tease, [ghost.speech(My place later, just like old times.)]

Letting out a deep, rumbling growl, Hammer motions for you to follow as he moves in front of Ghost to take the lead...

#ELSE

Following Ghost, you find yourself moving through the area which once served as the bakery's shop floor. The shelving units, tables, and chairs which were left here when the bakery was abandoned have either been pushed up against the far wall or used to smash the glass counter to pieces, leaving all of the floor area in this room clear of furniture.

On the far side of this area, you see the familiar, grey-furred form of Hammer. Standing over the bodies of a couple of gang members, he motions for the two of you to hurry to his location.

#ENDIF #ELSE

You once again find yourself moving through the area which once served as the bakery's shop floor. The shelving units, tables, and chairs which were left here when the bakery was abandoned have either been pushed up against the far wall or used to smash the glass counter to pieces, leaving all of the floor area in this room clear of furniture.

A couple of defeated gang members are sprawled out, unconscious, on the floor of this area. Letting out a deep grunt, Hammer says, [hammer.speech(We need to keep moving...)]

#ENDIF

The Enforcers told you that they weren't expecting you to fight, and so you decide to sit this one out. [pc.Stepping] back, you watch as Hammer deals with these gang members.

Raising his shotgun, the wolf-boy fires off a round which hits [gangMember1.name] squarely in the chest. A cloud of choking tear gas instantly bursts forth from the projectile, engulfing both of his opponents. [gangMember2.Name] tries to rush through the poison cloud, but a powerful kick from the one-eyed wolf-boy sends [gangMember2.herHim] sprawling back into the noxious fumes.

[hammer.speech(I only fired one, so it'll clear in a moment,)] Hammer grunts at you while the two gang members fall to the floor in a fit of choking coughs and gasps. Within a few more seconds, the two of them have passed out, and after waiting for the fumes to fade away Hammer steps forwards and kicks their weapons to one side of the room.

[hammer.speech(Let's keep moving,)] the wolf-boy grunts at you.

#IF(!flags.hasFlag(FLAG_innoxia_sword_mission_exit) && !flags.hasFlag(FLAG_innoxia_ghost_following))

[pc.Stepping] over the remains of the bakery's front door, you follow Hammer into the building. The area immediately beyond the front entrance is enclosed by an internal wall to form a small antechamber, preventing you from seeing into the majority of the building's interior. Although you can't see them, you can hear several voices shouting out in alarm from somewhere beyond the archway that's immediately in front of you.

[hammer.speech(Stick with me!)] Hammer growls as he rushes into what appears to be the bakery's shop floor...

#ELSE

You find yourself standing before the bakery's front entrance. This area is enclosed by an internal wall to form a small antechamber, preventing you from seeing into the majority of the building's interior. The front door has been well and truly destroyed by Hammer during his ingress, allowing you to see out into the alleyway beyond.

[hammer.speech(Come on, we don't have time for this!)] Hammer growls, motioning for you to return the way you came.

#ENDIF

Before you stands a winding staircase that leads up to the next floor of the building. Taking a look back the way you came, Ghost states, [ghost.speech(We've covered all of this floor. The kidnapped refugees must be upstairs with Angelixx.)]

[hammer.speech(If they're still here, that is,)] Hammer growls in a frustrated tone, [hammer.speech(I'm starting to think that they might already have been teleported out of here...)]
